Importance.title: The importance of choosing GDPR cloud storage for your files
description: GDPR cloud storage protects your sensitive information and helps businesses prevent data breaches and fines for non-compliance.
By choosing EU-based companies like Internxt, you gain full control over your data, ensuring you can manage, access, and delete files as needed.

WhySwitchSection.title: Why you should switch to private cloud storage solutions
WhySwitchSection.subtitle: Switching to private cloud storage solutions guarantees your data stays private and secure from hackers and corporations. Unlike Google, Apple, or Microsoft, Internxt doesn’t collect, sell, or misuse your data. You have complete control over your files.
WhySwitchSection.description: Invest in your privacy and get peace of mind that your files and data are protected against data breaches.

WhatWeDo.subtitle: Internxt offers GDPR cloud storage for personal, business, or enterprise use. With our advanced encryption, access controls, and privacy-focused approach, our cloud storage provides the best solution for GDPR compliance.

square1.title: Internxt Drive
square1.description: Internxt Drive is a private, GDPR-compliant cloud storage solution designed with privacy at its core. It only collects the necessary data to provide the best service and never shares your information with anyone.

square2.title: Internxt for Business
square2.description: Non-compliance with the GDPR can lead to heavy fines, making it essential for businesses to align their data practices with its standards. Internxt for Business provides a GDPR-compliant cloud storage solution that secures your company’s data with advanced security features.

square3.title: Internxt S3
square3.description: Internxt S3 is an enterprise-grade object storage solution that ensures your data is fully protected and compliant with GDPR. Internxt S3 offers GDPR compliant cloud storage, which guarantees 99.999999999% (11 9s) data durability for backed-up files, protecting them from loss or corruption.

FeaturesSection.title: What are your rights under the GDPR?
FeaturesSection.description: Under the GDPR, you have the right to access your data, request its deletion, and object to its use. With a privacy-first cloud service like Internxt, you control your data.

info.title: Right to access your data
description: The GDPR’s right to access policy allows you to know what personal data about you is stored by a company, how they use it, and who has access to it, including third countries or international organizations.
With GDPR cloud storage, you have full control over your data, how it is handled, and the power to take action if you disagree with a company's data handling policies.

info.title: Right to be forgotten
description: You have the power to request deletion of your personal data from a service when it is no longer needed, collected unlawfully, or you wish to withdraw your consent for your data to be used.

This gives you more control over your digital footprint, helping prevent identity theft, data breaches, or fraud. This prevents companies from holding your data indefinitely without a valid reason, making GDPR cloud services a stronger option if you want more privacy online.

info.title: Object to data processing
description: The GDPR also gives you the right to stop a company from using your data for marketing, profiling, or other purposes outside legal obligations.

With the right to object to data processing, you can prevent unwanted data tracking, targeted advertising, or data profiling. GDPR compliant cloud services such as Internxt never use your personal data for these purposes, guaranteeing your privacy from the moment you create your account.

info.title: Withdraw consent
description: To prevent you from being locked into agreements with a company, the GDPR also gives you the right to revoke permission for a company to process your personal information.

By withdrawing consent for companies to process your data, you can keep it away from third-party companies and reduce the risk of data breaches, preventing malicious actors and external companies from profiting from your data.

faq.question: What is the GDPR?
answer: The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) is a comprehensive data protection law by the European Union that protects personal data and privacy for individuals within the EU.
It outlines strict rules regarding how personal data is collected, stored, processed, and shared, requiring businesses to implement security measures and adhere to privacy principles.

faq.question: What is GDPR cloud storage?
answer: GDPR compliance cloud services refer to cloud companies operating in the EU that must comply with regulations that protect personal data with encryption, access controls, backups, and follow protocols to handle data safely.

faq.question: How can I ensure my business remains GDPR compliant when using cloud storage?
answer: To ensure GDPR compliance, choose a cloud storage provider that offers encryption, access controls, backup solutions, and transparency about data handling. Internxt’s business plans can provide GDPR compliant cloud storage with full control over your customer, employee, and business data.

faq.question: Can I store sensitive personal data in GDPR-compliant cloud storage?
answer: Yes, GDPR compliant cloud storage is designed to securely store sensitive personal data. Zero-knowledge encryption protects your files with Internxt to meet the GDPR's stringent data protection laws.

faq.question: What’s included with Internxt’s private cloud storage solutions?
answer: Internxt paid subscription and lifetime plans offer post-quantum encrypted cloud storage, an ultra-fast unlimited VPN for up to 5 locations, antivirus, and future access to our Mail and Meet products for Premium and Ultimate plans.

faq.question: How do I contact support?
answer: Can't find what you're looking for? You can contact our Customer Success team via live chat or by sending an email to hello@internxt.com.

faq.question: Can I pay with credit card, PayPal, or cryptocurrency?
answer: Internxt currently accepts debit and credit cards (Mastercard, VISA, American Express, etc). You can also pay via PayPal, iDEAL, Sofort, and Cryptocurrency.

FeatureSection.title: How GDPR cloud storage protects your data
FeatureSection.description: Internxt meets GDPR’s strict requirements by providing zero-knowledge encryption, user access control, and secure backups to keep your data safe and private.

element1.title: End-to-end encryption
description: End-to-end encryption is a secure method to protect your files from hackers, but many companies manage the keys and could give access to your files to the government if requested. Internxt uses zero-knowledge and post-quantum encryption, ensuring the keys are stored only on your device, so no one but you can access your data.
Our advanced, award-winning encryption gives you maximum security that aligns with GDPR's strict requirements for protecting personal data and preventing cyberattacks.

element2.title: Access controls and user permissions
description: The GDPR instructs organizations to implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to ensure a level of security appropriate to the risk, including controls and user permissions to limit access to sensitive data.

GDPR compliance cloud services include access and user permissions to meet these requirements. Internxt Drive includes password-protected file sharing and controls to restrict access. Internxt Business plans include access logs to track who signed in, uploaded, or modified files, ensuring compliance across the whole team.

element3.title: Data backups and recovery
description: The GDPR states that companies must take measures to restore the availability and access to personal data in a timely manner in the event of a physical or technical incident.

With Internxt, you get GDPR-compliant cloud storage thanks to scheduled or manual backups, and your data is securely stored across multiple data centers. This approach increases redundancy and guarantees fast access to your backed-up files, allowing you to restore data quickly in case of an incident and maintain personal security and compliance for businesses.

element4.title: Data minimization
description: Data minimization is a fundamental principle for the GDPR and private cloud storage providers. It requires organizations to collect and process only the personal data that is adequate, relevant, and necessary for specific purposes.

We prioritize your privacy by protecting all your data with zero-knowledge encryption, ensuring only you can access it. We never share your data with anyone, giving you complete control and peace of mind over your personal information.
